snippet: Xu Zhiyong, who was held Tuesday on unlawful-assembly charges, has challenged the Communist Party to act on its vows to expose corruption and respect the rule of law.
abstract: Police in Beijing detain Xu Zhiyong, one of China’s most prominent rights advocates; it is latest in series of arrests that critics say shows Communist Party’s determination to silence campaigners who have challenged party to act on its vows to expose official corruption and respect rule of law.

byline.contributor: Patrick Zuo contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Xu Zhiyong, who was held Tuesday on unlawful-assembly charges, has challenged the Communist Party to act on its vows to expose corruption and respect the rule of law.
